text: Parliamentary elections were held in Laos on 2 January 1972.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, p135 They were contested by around 200 candidates, and more than two-thirds of incumbent MPs lost their seats.Laos Inter-Parliamentary Union Voter turnout was 67.8%. This would be the last election held in Laos before the Communists seized power in 1975. To date, it is also the last contested election held in the country. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text- align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats |- |align=left|National Progressive Party|| || ||3 |- |align=left|Other parties|| || ||57 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes|| ||–||– |- |align=left|Total||619,271|| ||60 |- |colspan=4 align=left|Source: Nohlen et al. |} ==References== Laos Category:1972 in Laos Category:Elections in Laos Category:January 1972 events in Asia
title: 1972 Laotian parliamentary election
